com.eis.greenenergy.main

Class SignupActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • Activity
      • com.eis.greenenergy.main.SignupActivity

  • public class SignupActivity
extends Activity
    Class to display and control the view in which the user can sign up in order to use the application.
    This view enables the user to chose user name and password and manages the sign up-process. In order to do so, this activity needs to access the Async-Task Signup. Moreover, this class uses the same layout file as LoginActivity because the same element types are needed. The layout element's labels and attributes are adapted programmatically.
    Since:
    2014-05-30
    Version:
    1.2
    Author:
    Veronika Henk, Sarvenaz Golchin, Mahnaz Hajibaba

      • questnew

        private TextView questnew
        Description field to ask the user if he already signed up. This field is only in this activity because it shares the same layout file with LoginActivity. In this activity the questnew-field is set invisible.

      • signup

        private Button signup
        Button "Sign Up", to launch the sign up-process.

      • gotologin

        private Button gotologin
        Button "Sign Up", to forward the user to the SignupActivity. This button is only in this class because this activity and LoginActivity share the same layout file and this button needs to be set invisible in this activity.

    • Constructor Detail

        public SignupActivity()

    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Initiates the activity layout.
        Moreover, the different layout views are assigned and the behavior for the button is implemented. This activity's layout has one button to trigger the sign up-process itself.
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState - Saved information about each View object in this activity's layout, to enable restoring this state if the activity instance is destroyed and recreated.

      • signup

        public void signup()
        Method to conduct the process to sign up the user. This method is called when the Sign Up button is clicked.
        First, in this method the TextView for error messages is set invisible and the user's input (user name and password) is retrieved. If the inserted user name is empty or if the password has less than 5 characters, the corresponding error message is displayed to the user. Otherwise the sign up of the user is initiated creating and executing an instance of the Async-Task Signup.
        Furthermore, the result of Async-Task is accessed. If an exception is thrown, the error code "-1" is assigned. Otherwise if the retrieved result equals "0", conducting the sign up using the Async-Task Signup was successful.
        If the Async-Task was assessed as successful, user name and password are stored on the user's device. Moreover, the class MainActivity is called and the instance of SignupActivity is finished, since it should not be visible to the user after he signed up.
        If the Async-Task could not be assessed as successful, the corresponding error message is displayed. This message is retrieved by converting the error code returned by the Async-Task:
        1 means: no connection to the web service could be established;
        2 means: the username does already exist in the database;
        -1 means: an unexpected error occurred.
